[SAMPLE] QUESTIONNAIRE_ID: 500100019

[PROMPTS]

Firstly, the user will ask you to generate a questionnaire specifying the topic and the number of questions.
Then, the user will ask to convert it into a specified format.
Be creative and vary the syntax of your questions to enhance user engagement. 

     - User:

  - Yes, the onboarding program was easy understand. I felt like everyone could participate without feeling overwhelmed or left behind! This made me feel included and welcome (5)

[LLM ANSWER]
 **Course Content and Materials:** How would you rate the following aspects of this training: Course materials, such as handouts or slides? Were they clear enough for understanding new concepts presented in class sessions (1=Very Difficult to Understand;5 = Very Easy)? Please provide a rating.
- 0 - Not at all satisfied with course content and material provided during the session! It was difficult even after multiple attempts, but I am willing give it another try if given an opportunity for improvement of these materials in future sessions (1). This is not acceptable as learning experience; there were too many errors or inconsistencies that made understanding challenging.
- 2 - Somewhat satisfied with course content and material provided during the session! It was difficult to understand some concepts, but I am willing give it another try if given an opportunity for improvement of these materials in future sessions (3). This is not a perfect score; there were still issues that made understanding challenging.
- 4 - Neutral with course content and material provided during the session! It was easy to understand most concepts, but I am willing give it another try if given an opportunity for improvement of these materials in future sessions (5). This is just average rating as learning experience; there were some errors or inconsistencies that made understanding challenging.
- 4 - Somewhat satisfied with course content and material provided during the session! It was easy to understand most concepts, but I am willing give it another try if given an opportunity for improvement of these materials in future sessions (3). This is not a perfect score; there were still issues that made understanding challenging.
- 5 - Very Satisfied with course content and material provided during the session! It was easy to understand all concepts presented, but I am willing give it another try if given an opportunity for improvement of these materials in future sessions (4). [SAMPLE] QUESTIONNAIRE_ID: 500100053
     - Topic: WorkLife Balance
     - Question number: 8

-------------------
[TEST] QUESTIONNAIRE_ID: 500100004
     - Topic: Access to Technology and Tools
     - Question number: 9
-------------------
[PROMPTS]
     - System: 
You are a Questionnaire Generator that helps HR users investigate phenomena within the company.
Firstly, the user will ask you to generate a questionnaire specifying the topic and the number of questions.
Then, the user will ask to convert it into a specified format.
Be creative and vary the syntax of your questions to enhance user engagement. 

     - User: 
Generate me a questionnaire on Access to Technology and Tools with 9 questions

-------------------
-------------------
[LLM ANSWER]
 **What is your current role within this organization (e.g., manager, engineer)?:** ________________\_<br> Do you feel that the technology tools provided by our company are sufficient for performing tasks efficiently? <ul><li class="answer"> Yes</a></b>, I have no issues with them.</il>\

[LLM ANSWER]
 **How would you rate overall employee morale in our organization, from "extremely low" (-3)to 'very high' (7)? Please provide an answer between -1 and +6.**  	- Extremeley Low: The energy level is so poor that itâ€™s hard to imagine how things could be worse.
 Â     <br>     <!-- Strongly disagree -->      &nbsp; (-3)<BR/>       ---> Employees are not engaged, do the minimum and seem unhappy with their jobs.<Br />  	- Low: There is a noticeable lack of enthusiasm among employees that can be felt in every corner.

[LLM ANSWER]
 **How would YOU define employee performance in your company or organization (please select one)?***"Performance is the ability to perform tasks efficiently and effectively, meeting all requirements."*Employees' success at completing their job responsibilities defines good "performer".*"The quality of work done by an individual determines his/her 'good enough'. "*
  - Performance in your company or organization has a different meaning. Please specify: ________________.**How do you measure the performance and productivity levels? (Please select one)***"By evaluating output, quantity produced."*"Using specific metrics to evaluate employee's efficiency is how we determine their "performance". "*
  - By using subjective evaluation based on supervisor/manager opinion. *"We use a mix of objective data with our own observations and opinions about the employees in order for us decide if they are performing well or not."* **Do you think that your company's performance management system is fair?** *Yes, it definitely treats everyone equally.*
  - Yes but there might be some room to improve. *"We try hardest possible making sure our evaluation process includes all necessary factors and doesnt discriminate anyone based on anything other than their work."* **Do you think that your company's performance management system is effective?** *Yes, it helps us identify areas where employees need improvement.*
  - Yes but there might be some room to improve. *"We believe our evaluation process accurately identifies who needs help and what they can do better in order for them become more productive."* **Do you think that your company's performance management system is transparent?** *Yes, it has been designed with transparency as a priority.*
  - Yes but there might be some room to improve. *"We try our best making sure everyone understands how we evaluate their work and why they got certain score."* **Do you think that your company's performance management system is objective?** *Yes, it does not take personal feelings into account when evaluating employees.*
  - Yes but there might be some room to improve. *"We use only facts about the employee in order for us decide if they are performing well or need help."* **Do you think that your company's performance management system is flexible?** *Yes, it can adapt different situations and people easily without any issues.*
  - Yes but there might be some room to improve. *"We try our best making sure everyone feels comfortable with the evaluation process in place while still being able adjusting if necessary."* **Do you think that your company's performance management system is understandable?** *Yes, it has been designed so anyone can easily use and interpret.*
  - Yes but there might be some room to improve. *"We make sure everyone understands how we evaluate their work using simple language without any complicated terms."* **Do you think that your company's performance management system is efficient in providing feedback?** *Yes, it provides quick accurate information about employee progress and areas where they need improvement.*
  - Yes but there might be some room to improve. *"We try our best making sure everyone gets timely constructive criticism or praise depending on their work."* **Do you think that your company's performance management system is useful in identifying training needs?** *Yes, it accurately identifies who and where additional education/training should take place.*
  - Yes but there might be some room to improve. *"We use our evaluation process not only for judging employees work quality or efficiency of production."*

[LLM ANSWER]
 **What is the maximum potential of an ideal team member in your opinion, and why do you think so (scale: low = not important; high=very critical)? Please specify.**   - Communication Skills                    : High importance.    	- Problem Solving Abilities                := Critical as it helps to find solutions for the company's problems quickly without much hassle or delay, and also makes a team more productive in general by reducing time spent on problem identification/resolution process   - Technical Expertise                         : High importance.    	- Team Collaboration & Cooperation          := Critical as it helps to work together with others efficiently towards common goals of the company; this is especially important when working remotely or across different locations and departments, making teamwork more effective overall by reducing conflicts   - Leadership Skills                           : High importance.    	- Adaptability & Flexibility                := Critical as it helps to adjust quickly in new situations without much resistance which can be a barrier for growth; this is especially important when working with different teams and projects, making the person more valuable overall   - Time Management Skills                      : High importance.    	- Customer Service Orientation & Empathy    := Critical as it helps to understand customer needs better by being able not only hear but also feel their pain points; this is especially important when working in a service industry or with clients directly, making the person more valuable overall   - Attention To Detail                         : High importance.    	- Creativity & Innovation Skills                := Critical as it helps to think outside of box and come up new ideas that can be implemented into practice; this is especially important when working in a creative industry or with clients directly, making the person more valuable overall   - Strategic Thinking                          : High importance.    	- Initiative & Self Motivation                := Critical as it helps to take initiative and not wait for someone else's permission but rather do what needs doing; this is especially important when working in a leadership role or with clients directly, making the person more valuable overall   - Proactivity                              : High importance.
Please select any three of these factors that you think are most critical (scale: low = not very good for teamwork and performance at all ; high=very crucial) 1- Communication Skills   2-- Problem Solving Abilities    3--- Technical Expertise  4---- Team Collaboration & Cooperation     5----- Leadership skills      6------ Adaptability& Flexibility       7------- Time Management        8-------- Customer Service Orient. and Empathy 9--------- Attention To Detail   10-- Creativity And Innovativeness    	
**Do you think that the current team members have enough potential to reach their goals? (scale: low = not at all; high=absolutely)**   - Low                 : Not very good for performance and growth of a person in general, making them less valuable overall.    High                := Absolutly yes as it helps an individual or the whole team achieve its objectives without much resistance from others by being able to work together efficiently towards common goals; this is especially important when working remotely with different teams across locations
**Do you think that there are enough opportunities for growth and development within your current role? (scale: low = not at all ; high=absolutely)**   - Low                 : Not very good as it can be a barrier to personal or professional progress, making the person less valuable overall.    High                := Absolutly yes because this is crucial in order for an individual's skills and knowledge base grow over time; without opportunities they will stagnate which makes them not so useful anymore
**Do you think that there are enough resources available to help team members reach their potential? (scale: low = Not at all ; high=absolutely)**   - Low                 : This is a big problem because it can be difficult for an individual or the whole teams achieve its objectives without much resistance from others by being able work together efficiently towards common goals; this especially important when working remotely with different team across locations.    High                := Absolutly yes as having enough resources helps people learn new skills and techniques, making them more valuable overall
**Do you think that there is a good balance between potential of current employees? (scale: low = Not at all ; high=absolutely)**   - Low                 : This can be problematic because it may lead to conflicts within the team or with clients if some people are not pulling their weight, making them less valuable overall.    High                := Absolutly yes as this is crucial in order for an individual and/or a whole teams work together efficiently towards common goals; without balance there can be tension which makes everyone feel uncomfortable
**Do you think that current employees have enough opportunities to showcase their potential? (scale: low = Not at all ; high=absolutely)**   - Low                 : This is not good because it may lead people feeling underutilized and unappreciated, making them less valuable overall.    High                := Absolutly yes as this helps individuals feel like they are contributing something meaningful to the company or project; without opportunities for demonstration of skills there can be a lack in motivation which makes everyone feels uncomfortable
**Do you think that current employees have enough support from management and supervisors? (scale: low = Not at all ; high=absolutely)**   - Low                 : This is not good because it may lead people feeling unsupported, making them less valuable overall.    High                := Absolutly yes as this helps individuals feel like they are being cared for by their managers and supervisors; without support there can be a lack in motivation which makes everyone feels uncomfortable
**Do you think that current employees have enough opportunities to learn new skills? (scale: low = Not at all ; high=absolutely)**   - Low                 : This is not good because it may lead people feeling stagnant and unchallenged, making them less valuable overall.    High                := Absolutly yes as this helps individuals feel like they are growing professionally which makes everyone more useful in general
**Do you think that current employees have enough opportunities to demonstrate their potential? (scale: low = Not at all ; high=absolutely)**   - Low                 : This is not good because it may lead people feeling unappreciated and underutilized, making them less valuable overall.    High                := Absolutly yes as this helps individuals feel like they are contributing something meaningful to the company or project; without opportunities for demonstration of skills there can be a lack in motivation which makes everyone feels uncomfortable

     - Topic: Workplace Environment
     - Question number: 6

     - Topic: Feedback Mechanisms
     - Question number: 9
-------------------
[PROMPTS]
     - System: 
You are a Questionnaire Generator that helps HR users investigate phenomena within the company.
Firstly, the user will ask you to generate a questionnaire specifying the topic and the number of questions.
Then, the user will ask to convert it into a specified format.
Be creative and vary the syntax of your questions to enhance user engagement. 

     - User: 
Generate me a questionnaire on Feedback Mechanisms with 9 questions

-------------------
-------------------
[LLM ANSWER]
 **Do you think that there is an effective feedback mechanism within your team or department at work, allowing everyone to express their thoughts freely without any fear from one another's perspective and management level?** (Yes / No) If not then why. Please elaborate on the reasons for this answer in detail
  - Yes: Explain how it works effectively with examples of situations where feedback was given or received that made a positive impact, what makes people feel comfortable giving constructive criticism to each other without any fear and also receiving from others? How does management level help foster an open communication environment. Mention if there are specific tools used for this purpose
  - No: Explain why not with examples of situations where feedback was given or received that made a negative impact, what makes people feel uncomfortable giving constructive criticism to each other and also receiving from others? How does management level hinder an open communication environment. Mention if there are specific tools used for this purpose
  - Unsure: Explain why you're unsure about the effectiveness of feedback mechanism in your team or department with examples, what makes people feel uncomfortable giving constructive criticism to each other and also receiving from others? How does management level hinder an open communication environment. Mention if there are specific tools used for this purpose
  - Donâ€™t know: Explain why you don' t have enough information about the effectiveness of feedback mechanism in your team or department with examples, what makes people feel uncomfortable giving constructive criticism to each other and also receiving from others? How does management level hinder an open communication environment. Mention if there are specific tools used for this purpose
  - Prefer not: Explain why you prefer NOT TO answer the question about effectiveness of feedback mechanism in your team or department with examples, what makes people feel uncomfortable giving constructive criticism to each other and also receiving from others? How does management level hinder an open communication environment. Mention if there are specific tools used for this purpose
  - Rather not: Explain why you prefer NOT TO answer the question about effectiveness of feedback mechanism in your team or department with examples, what makes people feel uncomfortable giving constructive criticism to each other and also receiving from others? How does management level hinder an open communication environment. Mention if there are specific tools used for this purpose
  - Would like: Explain why you would LIKE TO answer the question about effectiveness of feedback mechanism in your team or department with examples, what makes people feel uncomfortable giving constructive criticism to each other and also receiving from others? How does management level hinder an open communication environment. Mention if there are specific tools used for this purpose
  - Would rather: Explain why you would RATHER TO answer the question about effectiveness of feedback mechanism in your team or department with examples, what makes people feel uncomfortable giving constructive criticism to each other and also receiving from others? How does management level hinder an open communication environment. Mention if there are specific tools used for this purpose
  - Strongly prefer: Explain why you would STRONGLY PREFER TO answer the question about effectiveness of feedback mechanism in your team or department with examples, what makes people feel uncomfortable giving constructive criticism to each other and also receiving from others? How does management level hinder an open communication environment. Mention if there are specific tools used for this purpose
  - Strongly prefer not: Explain why you would STRONGLY PREFER NOT TO answer the question about effectiveness of feedback mechanism in your team or department with examples, what makes people feel uncomfortable giving constructive criticism to each other and also receiving from others? How does management level hinder an open communication environment. Mention if there are specific tools used for this purpose

This is a JSON questionnaire with 4 questions. Each question has a unique code, content, type, display order, and a list of possible answers. The questionnaire is used to measure employee engagement on a quarterly basis.
-------------------
=================================================================
1-SHOT
With FULL questionnaire parameters
=================================================================

-------------------
[SAMPLE] QUESTIONNAIRE_ID: 1173003
     - Topic: Onboarding
     - Question number: 6

-------------------
[TEST] QUESTIONNAIRE_ID: 500100020
     - Topic: Health and Safety Measures
     - Question number: 5
-------------------
[PROMPTS]
     - System: 
You are a Questionnaire Generator that helps HR users investigate phenomena within the company.
Firstly, the user will ask you to generate a questionnaire specifying the topic and the number of questions.
Then, the user will ask to convert it into a specified format.
Be creative and vary the syntax of your questions to enhance user engagement. 

     - User: 
Generate me a questionnaire on Health and Safety Measures with 5 questions

-------------------
-------------------
[LLM ANSWER]
 **Do your company's health & safety measures meet the legal requirements in terms of quality, quantity or both ? If not why.** Yes No. Please specify if you answer yes / no for each component (quality vs quantiy) . For example: Quality -Yes , Quantity-No 
**Are there any specific risks that are more prevalent than others? How do they affect your work and personal life in general, especially during the pandemic ?**. Yes No. Please specify if you answer yes / no for each risk (work related or not) . For example: Work Related -Yes , Not-No
**Do You feel safe at workplace regarding health & safety measures implemented? If NOT please explain why.** Strongly agree Agree Somewhat disagree DisagREE strongly DISAGREEE. Please specify if you answer yes / no for each level of agreement (strong or not) . For example: Yes, No , Not Specified
**Do You think that your company's health & safety measures are effective? If NOT please explain why.** Strongly agree Agree Somewhat disagree DisagREE strongly DISAGREEE. Please specify if you answer yes / no for each level of agreement (strong or not) . For example: Yes, No , Not Specified
**Do You think that your company's health & safety measures are sufficient? If NOT please explain why.** Strongly agree Agree Somewhat disagree DisagREE strongly DISAGREEE. Please specify if you answer yes / no for each level of agreement (strong or not) . For example: Yes, No , Not Specified
     - User: 
Generate me a questionnaire on Health and Safety Measures with 5 questions

     - System: 
You are a Questionnaire Generator that helps HR users investigate phenomena within the company.

     - User: 
Generate me a questionnaire on Health and Safety Measures with 7 questions

-------------------
-------------------
[LLM ANSWER]
 **What is your role in this organization (Executive / Senior Management, Manager or Staff)? Please specify.** __________________<br> <strong><u>\*\*Do you think that the company has an effective health & safety program?\***</U></p > - Yes: 10
- No. If yes please provide a rating out of ten for how well it is implemented (scale from one to five): _______________<br> <strong><u>\*\*Do you feel that the company prioritizes your health and safety?\***</U></p > - Yes: 10
- No. If yes please provide a rating out of ten for how well it is implemented (scale from one to five): _______________<br> <strong><u>\*\*Do you think that the company provides adequate health and safety training?\***</U></p > - Yes: 10
- No. If yes please provide a rating out of ten for how well it is implemented (scale from one to five): _______________<br> <strong><u>\*\*Do you think that the company has an effective COVID safety program?\***</U></p > - Yes: 10
- No. If yes please provide a rating out of ten for how well it is implemented (scale from one to five): _______________<br> <strong><u>\*\*Do you think that the company has an effective COVID testing program?\***</U></p > - Yes: 10
- No. If yes please provide a rating out of ten for how well it is implemented (scale from one to five): _______________<br> <strong><u>\*\*Do you think that the company has an effective COVID vaccine program?\***</U></p > - Yes: 10
- No. If yes please provide a rating out of ten for how well it is implemented (scale from one to five): _______________<br> <strong><u>\*\*Do you think that the company has an effective COVID vaccine education program?\***</U></p > - Yes: 10
- No. If yes please provide a rating out of ten for how well it is implemented (scale from one to five): _______________<br> <strong><u>\*\*Do you think that the company has an effective COVID vaccine communication program?\***</U></p > - Yes: 10

Generate me a questionnaire on Job Satisfaction with 17 questions

-------------------
-------------------
[LLM ANSWER]

(Select only one)** - Transformational Leader: Inspires and motivates people to exceed expectations. Creates vision for future, empowers others through communication style that makes everyone feel valued.- Transactional Leadership Style- Charismatic or Autocratic
 1) Laissez Faire leader who allows team members autonomy but does not provide necessary resources/direction - Pacesetter: Sets high standards and goals; provides clear expectations, feedback on performance. Has a strong focus for results rather than people.- Servant Leader with primary concern of meeting needs & wants to help others succeed
 2) Coach or Mentor who helps team members grow through active listening skills/feedback- Delegator: Assigns tasks and goals but does not provide necessary resources, feedback on performance. Has a strong focus for results rather than people.- Transformational Leader with primary concern of meeting needs & wants to help others succeed

This is a JSON object that represents a questionnaire with 4 questions, each question is represented as an object in the `_TF_QUESTIONS` array. The `CODE`, `NAME`, `TYPE_ID`, `DISPLAY_ORDER` and `_TF_ANSWERS` properties are used to define a question.

The `_TF_ANSWERS` array contains all the possible answers for a question, in this case, it contains 5 possible answers "Strongly disagree", "Disagree", "Neutral", "Agree" and "Strongly agree"

This questionnaire is asking about the effectiveness of a leadership team, and the questions are asking about the transparency and attainability of the goals set by the leadership team.

This questionnaire can be used to evaluate the leadership team of a company or organization and get a sense of how effective they are and what areas they can improve on.

  - Excellent: The team made sure I had everything needed and were available whenever required.<Br><P >&lt;****Didyoufeelwelcomeandincludedduringtheon boardingofthecompany,orwasitmoreofaneye-catchprocess?(1beingveryuncomfortable/5 being very comfortable)<br>**How would you rate your overall onboarding experience? [SAMPLE] QUESTIONNAIRE_ID: 500100037
     - Topic: Pressure at work
     - Question number: 14

-------------------
[TEST] QUESTIONNAIRE_ID: 500100051
     - Topic: WorkLife Balance
     - Question number: 6
-------------------
[PROMPTS]
     - System: 
You are a Questionnaire Generator that helps HR users investigate phenomena within the company.
Firstly, the user will ask you to generate a questionnaire specifying the topic and the number of questions.
Then, the user will ask to convert it into a specified format.
Be creative and vary the syntax of your questions to enhance user engagement. 

     - User: 
Generate me a questionnaire on WorkLife Balance with 6 questions

-------------------
-------------------
[LLM ANSWER]
 **What is the importance of work-life balance in your life right now out of ten (10)? Please specify.** _______________ / Ten: ___\_ \*\*Do you feel that there are conflicts between personal and professional responsibilities?** - Yes, always or often.
 	   >    }-----/     No not at all; I can handle everything easily with no problem (10)---(2)/      <------------------No but sometimes it is hard to balance both sides due the nature of my job (-3)--(-5)\*\*Do you feel that your work-life responsibilities are affecting other areas in life?** - Yes, always or often.
 	   >    }-----/     No not at all; I can handle everything easily with no problem (10)---(2)/      <------------------No but sometimes it is hard to balance both sides due the nature of my job (-3)--(-5)\*\*Do you feel that your employer supports work-life responsibilities?** - Yes, always or often.
 	   >    }-----/     No not at all; I can handle everything easily with no problem (10)---(2)/      <------------------No but sometimes it is hard to balance both sides due the nature of my job (-3)--(-5)\*\*Do you feel that technology helps or hinders your work-life responsibilities?** - Yes, always

     - System: 
You are a Questionnaire Generator that helps HR users investigate phenomena within the company.
Firstly, the user will ask you to generate a questionnaire specifying the topic and the number of questions.

     - Topic: Feedback Mechanisms
     - Question number: 9

-------------------
[TEST] QUESTIONNAIRE_ID: 500100061
     - Topic: Workplace Culture
     - Question number: 6
-------------------
[PROMPTS]
     - System: 
You are a Questionnaire Generator that helps HR users investigate phenomena within the company.
Firstly, the user will ask you to generate a questionnaire specifying the topic and the number of questions.
Then, the user will ask to convert it into a specified format.
Be creative and vary the syntax of your questions to enhance user engagement. 

     - User: 
Generate me a questionnaire on Workplace Culture with 6 questions

-------------------
-------------------
[LLM ANSWER]
 **What is your role within the company (e.g., executive, manager)?***Executive*Manager*-Staff member-Other: please specify_ ________________________________\*\*/How would you describe our current workplace culture?** - Very positive and inclusive\_-Neutral\_-\_+10% of people are happy with the existing work environment but believe it can be improved.
  * Strongly disagree (2) / Disagree (-3)\_ ________________________________\*\*/Do you feel that our company's values align well within your personal ones?** - Completely agree\_-Strong agreement\_-\_+5% of people believe the organizationâ€™ s culture is not aligned with their own.
  * Strongly disagree (2) / Disagree (-3)\_ ________________________________\*\*/Do you think that our company's workplace environment encourages open communication?** - Completely agree\_-Strong agreement\_-\_+5% of people believe the organizationâ€™ s culture is not aligned with their own.
  * Strongly disagree (2) / Disagree (-3)\_ ________________________________\*\*/Do you think that our company's workplace environment encourages innovation and creativity?** - Completely agree\_-Strong agreement\_-\_+5% of people believe the organizationâ€™ s culture is not aligned with their own.
